document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

20612E9E20FA46FD9DE65FC2BF62DF99.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

56824B6FE9B64F0EA1A71A2531BCFE9F.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words by identifying other
words with similar and different meanings.

B66B952827794E8796A035365FEFE6BC.description:
Identify the meaning of simple similes (e.g., the man
was as big as a tree.).

B693BB103D244D428299DC5461A79905.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

70BF3C3C11A14312BEDD756295510310.description:
Seek clarification and meaning support when unfamiliar
words are encountered while reading or communicating.

971B0E4081B048DF8DCFD9E5E69781C1.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and the
words that result when affixes are added (e.g., liked,
disliked, liking).

6C0458C4E423438FA623ADD58F0FD5A5.description:
Use context to determine which word is missing from a
content area text.

313DD17E997A45F3B75302A7B64AE965.description:
Vary use of language when the listener or reader does
not understand the initial attempt.

C7CD6122864644EE8D76B1DB7604A61C.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

8ED54353D70342C994A08EE56688486C.description: Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on letter-sound relationships and common spelling patterns.

A480CB093893478B8F748FA41C33ED12.description: Use question marks at the end of written questions.

2792DCDD35A94CF49622F806896BF834.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

BCE29FFF20A54E269F1A2E64A2939A4F.description: Use personal pronouns (e.g., he, she, they) correctly.

9FDEB3AC5A9A45A88D89D914C7CE8840.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

9855C3735DD5465FBD4052AD2EE4ED92.description:
Use formal and informal language as
appropriate to the communication partner.

3A93D9F26D0A486B95B5149F6FC77BF4.description:
Select an auditory, visual, or tactual display to
clarify the information in presentations.

FC64C34CF6EF4505A37ABFCC55A34B87.description:
Present findings on a topic including
descriptions, facts, or details.

E1A30EA3899D409EA078C557782D9DFE.description:
Identify the reasons and evidence supporting
the claims made by the speaker.

167CF1254A4140C68437B1F8E29138A3.description:
Identify information presented in diverse media
and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) that relates to
a topic, text, or issue under study.

968536F5249841089BFAAA956E8F1FA3.description: Restate key ideas expressed in the discussion.

970BFF7D7CFB44D8B31F47ACD2C044A2.description:
Ask and answer questions specific to the topic, text, or
issue under discussion.

BF9FE2E1B8B54D0E918178AD19CFF0FF.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, follow
simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions and contribute
information.

488CC3A1696C44D98976F8B5708C4B6B.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

6E0DFF805403433A9B9CF642EE735B13.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

6DBE23A99AAA4932B74DDEA09AE2CF1B.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 6 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Can produce an
argument by logically organizing the claims and the
supporting reasons and evidence.”).

A96BC542CE79488EB4AD9ED9EA11643A.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 6 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Compare a text version
of a story, drama, or poem with an audio, video, or live
version of the text.”).

E2EF2FF9E757442B81E43B2692922127.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

1A3735E8FE004E678B7FB8D2283EB4FB.description:
Gather information from multiple print and
digital sources that relates to a given topic.

E8D4821FB32E490CBA9058ED194D613A.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a
question.

61285A9A133E42C38157AD438AA729CC.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

377DC704107348BB9C657EC2B718F195.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing while interacting and collaborating with others.

028380327D4B410997B94897CABB110C.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

097537EB158C4B20960707422CA65424.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

1313FE143F6B48A4AB5E7B8E1BDED52A.description:
Use words that convey specific details about the
experience or event.

4B629E83E38D446295DDFFB33E2F3665.description: Use words that establish the time frame.

811A9DFD01144EB7B4CAF30BF1C93DA8.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience
introducing the experience and including two or more
events.

A8D6C838D7A349558C992132F82EBB6C.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

18E7F01961DD4ECCA5FE590275DDFE6A.description:
Provide facts, details, or other information related to the
topic.

C60CA9D78A634657A67E32BE37F4BC3E.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and
information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

C13982B373664AFB8AE6AC18A03BCCBD.description: Write to share information supported by details.

7A8F7C51882D421FA833E447226BB997.description:
Write one or more reasons to support a claim about a
topic or text.

79DB6F0B249F4F1A8B013F673483E301.description: Write a claim about a topic or text.

095DAB2DEEDA4FBB90E26D1B5928682F.description: Write claims about topics or text.

4588AC1B11B643099DDECA80A228DD14.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

31992637404C42E295979C5E2C52139D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

181D31AA48C64566A0EDD3A5859770FA.description:
Compare and contrast how two texts describe
the same event.

38F196464A174370B38DDC44514CCBFF.description:
Distinguish claims in a text supported by
reason.

39D2100D12E54BEB9EA07D6554CA180F.description:
Find similarities in information presented in
different media or formats as well as in text.

BFE413B9C09B43A2B282F58C035FE510.description:
Identify words or phrases in the text that
describe or show the author’s point of view.

89584FDF99E54D12BEE28DC71C434EBA.description:
Determine how the title fits the structure of the
text.

552DA163679B49D3BE0B510BA3D12654.description:
Determine how word choice changes the
meaning of a text.

755DB4854E0846FE8E356A8EEBBB4201.description:
Identify a detail that elaborates upon
individuals, events, or ideas introduced in a text.

B87DEC1251C349E6ABB666FC0B482EA6.description:
Determine the main idea of a passage and
details or facts related to it.

0C5E7121E2604F20B5C2A1F5F66B7EAD.description:
Analyze a text to determine what it says
explicitly as well as what inferences should be drawn.

A579D248914A4570A00BCC9B9CBE6D7E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively reading or listening to stories, dramas, or poetry

EAE3BB5C026D4708927E3A33BE035640.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E79A32899DB74FB1857BAFA652185B42.description:
Compare and contrast stories, myths, or texts
with similar topics or themes.

061492D01EBF46E89EF8C3B27340CE9A.description:
Compare the experience of reading or
listening to a written story, drama or poem with the experience
of watching video or live performance of the same text.

26CA869FBD474395A1D6DB96E0670ACA.description:
Identify words or phrases in the text that
describe or show what the narrator or speaker is thinking or
feeling.

EF5481B3C4994971BDAADA688997D922.description:
Determine the structure of a text (e.g., story,
poem, or drama).

A604011B67514EDC8E10C581B95B5BEE.description:
Determine how word choice changes the
meaning in a text.

0E20D87CEB70436289CF6AED9B60D7C1.description:
Can identify how a character responds to a
challenge in a story.

4AFEAF5FA1AA4CCD8724CB49EE07066D.description:
Identify details in a text that are related to the
theme or central idea.

1A26ED5211B54BC9876A1E19A0CB1D57.description:
Determine what a text says explicitly as well as
what simple inferences must be drawn.
